div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

li.a: Social. Emotional, and Mental Health Resources

ul.li: Free Meals/Food Service - Meal pickup locations are at CMS, Ashmore Elementary, and Lerna Elementary on Mondays, Wednesdays, & Fridays from 10:00am - 11:30am. We will continue this service throughout the school closure that has now been extended for the remainder of the previously scheduled 2019-20 school year. If you have not yet filled this form out and wish to, please use the link above to do so.
Mediacom is offering a Connect2Complete program with a free two month trial, followed by a discounted internet service price for students that qualify for free/reduced lunches.
Consolidated Communications is offering a free two month trial with no obligations to families that are experiencing school closure and in need of internet service. (for new members)

li.a: 21 Best Educational YouTube Channels for Kids
Tools for Communication with Families and Students
Guidance on Special Education and IEP Meetings

div.h1: CHARLESTON CUSD1 & ILLINOIS SCHOOL CLOSURE INFORMATION
div.p: Email your ideas to cusd1@charleston.k12.il.us for ways to best close out the 2020 school year, including suggestions on how to honor the Charleston Class of 2020!

March 23 - end of school year will be considered "ACT of GOD Days" and will not be made up. All school-related activities during this time have been POSTPONED or cancelled. Student work during this time cannot negatively impact a student's grades. it can only be used to increase their overall academic standing.

img.p: Remote Learning Days will begin in IL during closure
State of IL Executive Stay-at-Home Order

hr.h2: Updates from Superintendent Todd J. Vilardo:

h3.a: message from the COLES COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

div.p:
Charleston CUSD 1
410 W Polk
Charleston, IL 61920
Phone: (217) 639-1000

The School District strives to provide each student with the opportunity to acquire the very best education according to his or her needs and abilities. Upon leaving the school system, each student should have an employable skill and/or an adequate preparation for further training or education so that he or she may become a responsible, productive citizen. The schools also attempt to develop in each student an understanding of and appreciation for our American heritage.
